intro: Hippocratea semlikiensis, commonly known as the Semliki hippocratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its flowers are often pale yellow to greenish-white, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain edible seeds. Due to its restricted habitat and habitat loss, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
